com.dam_industries.dbaccess

Class UpdaterFuncts

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dam_industries.dbaccess.UpdaterFuncts

  • public class UpdaterFuncts
extends Object
    UpdaterFuncts are an assortment of functions used to update rows and tables in a predefined database environment. Also there's a tokenizer.

    Most methods are synchronized so they may not be interrupted while processing and will not overwrite rows by pulling from old data.

    All database access uses PreparedStatements which are closed immediately after use.

    If you use this, be sure to update the absolute path to your tables (i.e. database.table).

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andrew Moore

    • Method Detail

      • updateTermDocCount

        public static void updateTermDocCount(String tS)
                               throws SQLException
        Updates or creates entry for token specified in parameters.

        Method uses synchronized blocks so we don't lock the entire class on method call.

        Parameters:
        tS - The token to have its entry created or updated
        Throws:
        SQLException
        See Also:
        DB

      • updateDocTermFreq

        public static void updateDocTermFreq(String URL,
                     String tS,
                     int freq)
                              throws SQLException
        Updates the merged table. Table is combination of URL->Token->Freq.

        Method specifies synchronized in order to avoid unintentional PreparedStatement closures.

        Method is synchronized on the database connection and will not allow other threads
        to access the database during the update.

        Parameters:
        URL - The URL (Document) that we're adding to
        tS - The token we're attaching to the document
        freq - The frequency of tS (the token) in the URL (Document)
        Throws:
        SQLException
        See Also:
        DB

      • trashURL

        public static void trashURL(String URL)
                     throws SQLException
        Deletes the URL specified from the table of records we don't need to parse.

        A good chunk of URLs parsed lead to pictures, pdf files, etc. There's no reasonable way to handle them, so just throw them out when we get the chance.

        Method specifies synchronized in order to avoid unintentional PreparedStatement closures.

        Parameters:
        URL - The URL we wish to delete from our scraping record table
        Throws:
        SQLException
        See Also:
        DB

      • cleanRecords

        public static void cleanRecords(ArrayList<String> records,
                DB db)
                         throws SQLException
        Removes inaccessible records from the records table.

        Does not document why they are not accessible, will use trashURL(String) to
        remove the records.

        Prints progress every 500 iterations.

        Usees updQuickDocs(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) to locally store parsed documents for future use.

        Parameters:
        records -
        db -
        Throws:
        SQLException

        public static void updQuickDocs(String URL,
                String doc)
                         throws SQLException
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • tokenizer

        public static String[] tokenizer(String doc)
        Tokenizes the string (document)

        The string will be tokenized in the following order:
        1. Remove apostrophe
        2. Remove HTML tags (Anything between < and >)
        3. Convert all punctuation not already removed to "\s"
        4. Split on whitespace+ and newline+

        Parameters:
        doc - The string of text to be tokenized
        Returns:
        tDoc A static string array of tokens (warning, this may return spots with '\0' be sure to check str.length > 0)
